roleset.name: care for
roleset.note: TEND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'tend' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. No comparison. (from tend.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: I hope they 'll be able to make a go of it off in some city , but if it does n't work out they can always come back and tend the store . "
example.arg: if it does n't work out

roleset.name: have a tendency, drift
roleset.note: TEND-V NOTES: This really should be treated as a modal verb, almost, but we'll treatit instead like 'seem' et al. (from tend.02-v)
TRENDING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to trend.01 and tend.02. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from trending.01-n)

example.name: very typical usage
example.text: The cost, or premium, tends to get fat in times of crisis.
example.arg: to get fat in times of crisis
